dt: {bc}to agree to or approve of something (such as an idea or suggestion) especially after {d_link|thoughtful|thoughtful} consideration {bc}{sx|concur||}

pt: {sc}assent{/sc} {sc}consent{/sc} {sc}accede{/sc} {sc}acquiesce{/sc} {sc}agree{/sc} {sc}subscribe{/sc} mean to concur with what has been proposed. {sc}assent{/sc} implies an act involving the understanding or judgment and applies to propositions or opinions.
{sc}consent{/sc} involves the will or feelings and indicates compliance with what is requested or desired.
{sc}accede{/sc} implies a yielding, often under pressure, of assent or consent.
{sc}acquiesce{/sc} implies tacit acceptance or forbearance of opposition.
{sc}agree{/sc} sometimes implies previous difference of opinion or attempts at persuasion.
{sc}subscribe{/sc} implies not only consent or assent but hearty approval and active support.

quotes.t: One day I arrived at class to discuss some abolition treaties written during the early Romantic period. An African American woman, Stephanie, was introduced to me by one of my students. Stephanie asked if she could sit in on the class, and I of course {qword}assented{/qword}.
Christopher, on his end, is supposed to have {qword}assented{/qword} to and even welcomed this public confirmation of his own negligibility, not that foreign diplomats needed any.

Fearing that without a new batch of social measures the country would slip away from him, Roosevelt {qword}assented{/qword}—sometimes rather grudgingly—to proposals that in sum make up the semi-welfare state under which we have lived this past half century.

shortdef: to agree to or approve of something (such as an idea or suggestion) especially after thoughtful consideration : concur
